  • Method Details

    • getAllOrderStatuses

      List<String> getAllOrderStatuses()
      Get all the possible order statuses.
      Returns:
      the list of the names of order statuses

    • getOrderByOrderNumber

      RestaurantOrderDto getOrderByOrderNumber(String orderNumber) throws EntityNotFoundException
      Get an order by its order number.
      Parameters:
      orderNumber - the unique number which identifies an order
      Returns:
      the found order with the given order number
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if no order with the given identifier was found

    • getOrdersOfCustomerByStatus

      List<RestaurantOrderDto> getOrdersOfCustomerByStatus(User user, Optional<String> orderStatus)
      Get all orders of a given customer and with given status.
      Parameters:
      user - the customer whose orders are to be fetched
      orderStatus - the status of the searched orders
      Returns:
      a list of orders belonging to the given customer, filtered by the given status

    • getOrdersOfRestaurantByStatus

      List<RestaurantOrderDto> getOrdersOfRestaurantByStatus(String restaurantName, Optional<String> orderStatus)
      Get all orders belonging to a restaurant and with given status.
      Parameters:
      restaurantName - the name of the restaurant whose orders are to be fetched
      orderStatus - the status of the searched orders
      Returns:
      a list of orders belonging to the given restaurant, filtered by the given status

    • addOrder

      void addOrder(RestaurantOrderDto restaurantOrderDto) throws InvalidDataException
      Add a new order for a given restaurant.
      Parameters:
      restaurantOrderDto - the data related to the order which is to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidDataException - if the data related to the order is invalid, ex. contains missing/null values, non-numerical values for numerical fields, etc.

    • updateOrderStatus

      void updateOrderStatus(String orderNumber, String orderStatus) throws IllegalStateException, EntityNotFoundException
      Update the status of an existing order.
      Parameters:
      orderNumber - the number which uniquely identifies the order
      orderStatus - the new status of the order
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the order's status cannot be updated to the new status
      EntityNotFoundException - if no order was found with the given order number.
